title: TODO: Figure out what the title should be.

Address.description: An address expressed using postal conventions (as opposed to GPS or other location definition formats). This data type may be used to convey addresses for use in delivering mail as well as for visiting locations and which might not be valid for mail delivery. There are a variety of postal address formats defined around the world. (Source: HL7 FHIR).

AddressLine.description: Part of an address that contains the house number, apartment number, street name, street direction, P.O. Box number, delivery hints, and similar address information. (Source: HL7 FHIR).

Age.description:
How long something has existed (quantitative).
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C0001779

AgeGroup.description:
Subgroups of populations based on age.
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C0027362

AgeRange.description: A quantitative range of ages. One of the two ages must be specified.

Altitude.description:
Height above sea level or above the earth's surface. Measured with with WGS84 datum.
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C0002349

Annotation.description: A text note which also contains information about who made the statement and when.

Area.description:
The extent of a 2-dimensional surface enclosed within a boundary.
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C0205146

BodyPosition.description:
The position or physical attitude of the body.
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C1262869

BodySite.description:
A location in the body, including tissues, regions, cavities, and spaces, for example, right elbow, or left ventricle of the heart.
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C1545955

BodySiteMarker.description: A marker surgically placed at the site, often during a biopsy procedure, to pinpoint the location. The marker is typically a metal clip or radioactive seed.

BoundType.description: Indicates the actual value is lt (<) or lte (<=) the given value.

Certainty.description: The degree of confidence in a conclusion or assertion.

Circumference.description:
The length of such a boundary line of a figure, area, or object.
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C0332520

City.description:
The name of a city, town, village or other community or delivery center. (Source: HL7 FHIR).
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C1555315

ClockDirection.description:
A direction indicated by an angle relative to 12 o'clock.
Concepts: http://loinc.org:72294-2

CodeableConcept.description: A set of codes drawn from different coding systems, representing the same concept.

CodeSystemVersion.description: The version of the vocabulary being used, if applicable.

Coding.description:
Coding of a concept, drawn from a controlled vocabulary. Includes the vocabulary and version, if applicable. May include a display text, and a descriptor expressing the intended interpretation of the code.
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C0805701

Comment.description:
A critical or explanatory note written to discuss, support, explain changes to, or dispute information.
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C0947611

Count.description:
The number of non-null items in a referenced set of items or values.
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C0750480

Country.description:
Country - a nation as commonly understood or generally accepted, expressed in ISO 3166 Alpha-2 (2-letter) codes.
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C0454664

County.description:
The name of the administrative area at a level below that of a state but above that of a city or town. Outside the US, a district or the equivalent. (Source: HL7 FHIR).
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C0079170

Denominator.description:
The divisor of a fraction.
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C2825218

Depth.description:
The extent downward or inward; the perpendicular measurement from the surface downward to determine deepness.
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C0205125

Description.description:
An account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C0678257

Details.description:
Particulars considered individually and in relation to a whole.
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C1522508

Directionality.description:
Anatomical location or specimen further detailing directionality.
Concepts: https://evs.nci.nih.gov/ftp1/CDISC/SDTM/:C99074

DisplayText.description:
A string meant for reading by a person, usually accompanying a code.
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C1548311

Distance.description:
The space separating two objects or points.
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C0012751

Duration.description:
The length of time that something continues.
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C0449238

EffectiveDate.description:
The date when something is to take effect.
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C1301880

EffectiveTimePeriod.description:
The date and time span for which something is active, valid, or in force.
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C2985763

Explanation.description:
A set of statements describing a group of facts that clarifies the cause, context and/or consequence of those facts.
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C0681841

FamilyName.description:
The portion of a person's name that reflects the genealogy of the person. In western cultures, this is the 'last' name. In eastern cultures, the family name appears before the person's given name(s). In some cultures (e.g. Eritrea) the family name of a son is the first name of his father. (Source: HL7 V3).
Concepts: http://loinc.org:45394-4

Frequency.description:
How many occurrences of an event per unit of time.
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C0376249

GeneralizedAge.description: Qualitative or quantitative, exact or inexact description of age.

GeneralizedDateTime.description: A point in time, specified qualitatively or quantitatively.

GeneralizedDuration.description: The duration of an event, qualitatively or quantitatively.

GeneralizedFrequency.description: The frequency of an event, qualitatively or quantitatively.

GeneralizedLikelihood.description: Quantitative or qualitative measure of likelihood.

GeneralizedTemporalContext.description: A generalized indicator of a dateTime or an age when an event happened.

GeopoliticalLocation.description:
The countries of the world and major geopolitical subregions, such as US states.
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C0017446

Geoposition.description: The location on the surface of the Earth, described by a latitude and longitude (and optional altitude).

GestationalAge.description:
The age of the embryo or fetus. This may be assessed by medical history, physical examination, early immunologic pregnancy tests, radiography, ultrasonography, and amniotic fluid analysis.
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C0017504

GestationalTemporalContext.description: A named gestational time period, or a gestational age.

GestationalTimePeriod.description: A time relative to a pregnancy or childbirth event.

GivenName.description:
A set of names given to a person at birth, but not including the family name. In western cultures, this property would contain the 'first' and 'middle' names. Note that in some cultures, the given name is placed after the family name. Note also that this property contains multiple elements, so it can handle those situations where a person has more than one 'middle' name. (Source: HL7 V3).
Concepts: http://loinc.org:45392-8,http://snomed.info/sct:408677003

HumanName.description:
A name used by a human being, written as it would be typically expressed. May include a breakdown of the various elements of the name (family name, given name, etc.).
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C1547383

HumanNamePrefix.description:
Contains a set of honorific terms that typically appear before a person's name, for example Mr., Mrs., Dr., etc. Prefixes have a strong association to the immediately following name part. (Source: HL7 V3).
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C3476361

HumanNameSuffix.description:
Part of the name that is acquired as a title due to academic, legal, employment or nobility status, etc. and that appears at the end of the name.
Concepts: http://loinc.org:45395-1,http://snomed.info/sct:715196001

HumanNameUse.description: A qualifier specifying how a human name is used by a person, such as a legal name, alias, or nickname.

Identifier.description:
A unique string that identifies a specific person or thing.
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C0600091

Laterality.description:
Anatomical location or specimen further detailing the side(s) of interest.
Concepts: Anatomical laterality (http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C0925205)

Latitude.description:
The angular distance north or south between an imaginary line around a heavenly body parallel to its equator and the equator itself. Measured with with WGS84 datum.
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C1627936

Length.description:
The measurement or linear extent of something from end to end; the greatest dimensions of a body.
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C1444754

Likelihood.description:
A measure of the expectation of the occurrence of a particular event, as a percentage.
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C0033204

Location.description:
A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C0450429

Longitude.description:
An imaginary great circle on the surface of a heavenly body passing through the poles at right angles to the equator. Measured with with WGS84 datum.
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C1657623

LowerAgeBound.description: The lower limit on an age range

LowerBound.description: The lower limit on a quantitative value

Numerator.description:
The dividend of a fraction.
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C2825219

OccurrenceTime.description: The point in time or span of time in which something happens.

OrganizationalIdentifier.description: Unique identifier of something or someone, assigned by an organization, and potentially effective for only a limited time period.

Percentage.description:
A percentage value where 100.0 represents 100%.
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C0439165

PeriodOfUse.description: A period of time when a device, medication, or other therapy is used.

PortionTotality.description:
ObservationQualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing the portion or totality, which means arrangement of, or apportioning of an entity.
Concepts: https://evs.nci.nih.gov/ftp1/CDISC/SDTM/:C99075

PostalCode.description:
A postal code designating a region defined by the postal service.
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C1514254

Priority.description:
An ordinal numbered priority where 1=highest priority, 2=second highest priority, etc.
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C0549179

QualitativeDateTime.description: A point in time, described qualitatively.

QualitativeFrequency.description: The frequency of an event, described qualitatively.

Quantity.description: A quantity with units, whose value may be bounded from above or below.

Range.description: An interval defined by a quantitative upper and/or lower bound. One of the two bounds must be specified, and the lower bound must be less than the upper bound.

Ratio.description:
A unit of measurement for the quotient of the amount of one entity to another.
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C0456603

Reason.description:
The justification for an action or non-action, conclusion, opinion, etc.
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C0566251

SemiquantDuration.description: The duration of an event, described semi-quantitatively.

SemiquantFrequency.description: The frequency of an event, described semi-quantitatively.

Setting.description: Description of the place or type of surroundings where something is positioned or where an event takes place.

SpecificType.description: A code or description representing the concept represented by the instance at a specific level. For example, for a Condition, the concept is MTH#C0348080 (Condition) but the Value is the SpecificType, i.e. MTH#C0011849 (Diabetes Mellitus). For an observation, the SpecificType defines what is being observed, measured, or asked, as specifically as possible. The SpecificType should always align with the concept of the element, for example, a blood pressure observation can be coded as a sitting blood pressure or standing blood pressure, and may be from a different code system (e.g. LOINC versus MTH). In other cases, the SpecificType is the specific question being asked, or the specific goal being pursued.

State.description:
Sub-unit of a country with limited sovereignty in a federally organized country. A code may be used if codes are in common use (i.e. US 2 letter state codes). (Source: HL7 FHIR).
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C1552743

Statistic.description:
A quantity that represents a statistic, e.g. maximum, minimum, mean, median, etc.
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C2828391

StatisticType.description: The type of statistic that is represented by the value.

Substance.description:
Any matter of defined composition that has discrete existence, whose origin may be biological, mineral or chemical.
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C0439861

Summary.description:
A shortened version of an item of information, containing only the main points.
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C1706244

TimePeriod.description:
A period of time defined by a start and end time, date, or year.
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C1948053

TimePeriodEnd.description:
The time at which something is to end or did end.
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C1522314

TimePeriodStart.description:
The time at which something is to take effect, start, or did start.
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C1301880

Title.description: A distinguishing word or group of words naming an item.

UnitedStatesAddress.description: An address for a place in the USA, conforming to US mail postal conventions. (Source: HL7 FHIR).

UnitedStatesState.description:
A state or territory in the USA expressed by 2-letter US Postal code.
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C3148680

Units.description: Code for the unit of measure of the quantity.

UpperAgeBound.description: The upper limit on an age range

UpperBound.description: The upper limit on a quantitative value.

Version.description:
A string identifying the particular of form of something (such as a code system or software product) that is different in some way from another form of the same thing.
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C0333052

Volume.description:
The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C0449468

Width.description:
The measurement or extent of something from side to side.
Concepts: http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov:C0487742

description: The SHR Core domain contains definitions for a variety of general-purpose elements that are used widely in SHR. These include definitions for coding, expressions of time, quantities, addresses, names, and more.
